TopicTitle: Lower time warp values (e.g. 0.5x) -- for precise or tricky maneuvers and landings

Articles.Content:
Seems to me there's a reasonable need for a 0.5x time warp setting, whether it's landing a large and cumbersome spaceplane at KSP that is carrying heaps of science onboard after returning from an extended duration, or whether it's maneuvering said tricksome spaceplane in an unforgiving supersonic high Kerbin atmo re-entry, or whether it's getting that burn just right, or whether it's not getting burned on a high-G stressful landing on the Mun (Eve), or whether...

Am I the only one that feels this way?

Disclaimer: I checked [*this*](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/36863-What-not-to-suggest) and [*that*](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Planned_features) and even did a cursory search before this suggestion. (higher accels were forbidden but not lower)
That could be useful. Alternatively, it would be nice if we could pause the simulation while still rotating camera and issuing right-click-menu commands.
It's still being updated however when it's done I think "[Time Control](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69363-0-25-Time-Control-9-23-14-v13-2)" will do what you're looking for

It's useful, yes, but it's also kind of cheating. You can get the effect naturally, however, by having a slower computer or just running a ship large and complex enough to get into the yellow time dilation.

As long as we're discussing adding more time warp values, can I suggest changing 5x and 50x to 3x and 30x, and adding 300x, 3000x, and 30,000x?
+1, though i think it should have to be unlocked by upgrading the tracking station and only be available to automated systems, because a pilot can not simply "think quicker" whenever its neccesary...
But the pilot IRL has a team behind and more / more precise tools to preplan. Setting up a proper maneuver can be done a lot more inadvance than here and now in KSP....
